wikitext.*:
'''''verya-''''' is a [[Quenya]] verb for "to marry (of husband and wife), be joined to".<ref name=Vinyar>{{VT|49b}}, p. 45</ref> In earlier Quenya, the term for "to marry" was ''vesta-'',<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "BES"</ref> while ''verya-'' meant "to dare".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "[[BER]]"</ref>

==Etymology==
* [[Root]] BER ("to mate, be mated, joined in marriage")<ref name=Vinyar/>

==Other forms==
*''veryanen'' = "I married"
==See also==
*''[[veryanwë]]''
